intro: Boscia praecox, commonly known as the early bosco, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its thick, flaky bark and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when ripe. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Boscia praecox is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
